title: How to tune an electronic piano - Quora

response.answer_text: In addition to the excellent answer by User, it's also worth noting that electronic instruments, particularly keyboards, have the ability to detune as well. This is usually called a "pitch wheel" or something like that:   This allows you to temporarily change the frequency of a note. "Back in the day", with the Hammond B3, the notes were generated using a mechanical drive, and you did this by pushing against the drive shaft to slow down the motor:   You could also change the frequency after-the-fact by using mechanical post-processing effects. By rotating the speaker, the Doppler effect would make a constant note sound like a varying note to the listener. The most famous product that did this was the Leslie speaker (note rotating speaker at the top):   Here's the B3 + Leslie combo, in the hands of a master:   For the geeks:
